subject: Public Speaking
title: Mandela's Speech from the Dock
description: A quick, practical guide to Mandela's Speech from the Dock.

hook.text: In 1964, Nelson Mandela faced the death penalty. He turned his trial into a platform for justice.

buildup.text: Instead of defending himself, he explained why apartheid was the real crime, speaking for over three hours.

discovery.text: He ended by saying he was prepared to die for a free and democratic society. The courtroom fell silent.

twist.text: The judge sentenced him to life, not death. Many believe the speech's moral force made execution politically impossible.

climax.text: Twenty-seven years later, Mandela walked free and became president. The speech outlasted the prison.

punchline.text: He spoke as a prisoner and was heard as a president.

quiz.question: What sentence did Mandela receive after his dock speech?
